humanum_full_description_en:
From the " door ", the sound of " living ", the original meaning is estrangement, seen in the bronze inscriptions. "Shuowen": "Shuya. From the door, lively sound." "Poetry·Beifeng·Drumming": "Yu Yu is broad, but I am not alive." Zheng Xuanjian: "The people betrayed their relatives and left, the sergeants abandoned their appointments and separated. It's so far away, so I sighed."

" Wide " can mean roundabout and unrealistic. "Confucius Congzi: On the Book": "Confucius said: "The book is also about things, far and not wide, near and not forced, full of ambition without complaint, obedience but not flattery.""

" Kuo " also means isolation. Tang Dufu "Fasting in the Wind and Ship with a Pillow in the Book": "The letter is broad in the Central Plains, and the battle is deep."

" Kuo " also means parting. "Poetry‧Bei Feng‧Drumming": "Death and life have a broad bond, and you will become a son." Ma Ruichen explained: "Qi broad and death and life are relatively written, and clouds are united and separated."

" Wide " also means scarcity. "Han Shu·Gou Xia Zhi": "Those who are so wide and harmless will be connected by the Tun River, and the two rivers will be divided." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Broad, rare."

" Kuo " also means wide and big. Sima Xiangru of the Han Dynasty "Feng Chan Wen": "Consciousness and so on, soaked in. The cohesion flows, the martial arts pass away. You travel to the plains in the narrow, wide swimming foam."

" Broad " is also used to describe broad-mindedness and broad-mindedness. Tang Dufu "Send Long Sun Jiu to Serve the Judge in Wuwei": "If the talents are broad-minded, the island will be flooded and flooded."

" Kuo " also describes luxury. Jin Chenggongsui's "Fu of Heaven and Earth": "He Yin and Yang are unpredictable, and Wei Eryi is magnificent."

" Width " can also mean length. One of Tang Bai's "Jiweizhi": "There are mountains and rivers thousands of feet high, and rivers thousands of miles wide."

humanum_full_description:
從「門」，「活」聲，本義為疏遠，見於金文。《說文》：「疏也。从門，活聲。」 《詩‧邶風‧擊鼓》：「于嗟闊兮，不我活兮。」鄭玄箋：「眾叛親離，軍士棄其約，離散相遠，故于嗟歎之。」

　　「闊」可表示迂闊、不切實際。《孔叢子‧論書》：「孔子曰：『《書》之於事也，遠而不闊，近而不迫，志盡而不怨，辭順而不諂。』」

　　「闊」亦表示隔絕。唐杜甫〈風疾舟中伏枕書懷〉：「書信中原闊，干戈北斗深。」

　　「闊」也表示離別。《詩‧邶風‧擊鼓》：「死生契闊，與子成說。」馬瑞辰通釋：「契闊與死生相對成文，猶云合離聚散耳。」

　　「闊」也表示稀少。《漢書‧溝洫志》：「頃所以闊無大害者，以屯氏河通，兩川分流也。」顏師古注：「闊，稀也。」

　　「闊」還表示寬廣、闊大。漢司馬相如〈封禪文〉：「懷生之類，沾濡浸潤。協氣橫流，武節猋逝。邇狹遊原，遐闊泳沫。」

　　「闊」還用以形容形容胸襟開闊、才思廣博。唐杜甫〈送長孫九侍御赴武威判官〉：「若人才思闊，溟漲浸絕島。」

　　「闊」也形容豪奢。晉成公綏〈天地賦〉：「何陰陽之難測，偉二儀之奓闊。」

　　「闊」也可表示長度。唐白居易〈寄微之〉之一：「有山萬丈高，有江千里闊。」

闊字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　闊； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1338第30
【廣韻】【正韻】苦括切【集韻】【韻會】苦活切，?音适。【說文】疏也。一曰遠也。【爾雅·釋詁】闊，遠也。　又【廣韻】廣也。　又【韻會】闊，勤苦也。【詩·邶風】死生契闊。【傳】契闊，勤苦也。　又寬也。【前漢·王莽傳】闊其租賦。【註】闊，寬也。　又乖闊。【詩·邶風】于嗟闊兮。【疏】于嗟乎此軍伍之人，今日與我乖闊兮。　又?闊。【後漢·馬融傳】及漢祖杖劒，武夫勃興。憲令寬賒，文禮?闊。　又迂闊。【後漢·律歷志】至元封中，迂闊不審。　又【正韻】凡久不相見曰閒闊。【後漢·諸葛豐傳】閒何闊。　又【集韻】苦滑切，音䯇。義同。　又【韻補】叶音缺。【成公綏·天地賦】豈斯事之有徵，將言者之虛設。何隂陽之難測，偉二儀之奓闊。
